intro: Astracantha dolona, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky latex when damaged, a common trait among members of its family. It typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, often as a perennial herb. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
